Content.Name: Import Scores from ExamStat
Content.Title: Import Scores from ExamStat
Content.BodyCopy:
Objective
To demonstrate how to import scores from ExamStat into the gradebook of an I-Learn course.

Instructions
  1. Follow the URL provided to you to access the exam results.
  2. Enter your report #.
  3. Check to be sure the course and instructor information is correct.
  4. Click on the link for "student scores" in the left hand column.
  5. The screen will display columns with the student ID, student name, score, max possible, and percentage.
  6. Left click and drag to select all information. Then right click the selected text and select "copy."
  7. Open a blank excel document.
  8. Paste the information by right clicking the A1 cell and selecting the paste option.
  9. Delete all unnecessary information. This includes the student names, max points, and percentage.
  10. Insert a blank column between the student ID column and the points column.
  11. Select the student ID column.
  12. On the "Data" tab of Excel, click on "text to columns."
  13. Make sure "delimited" is selected as the file type. Click next.
  14. Uncheck any checked boxes and then check "other" and type into the blank a dash symbol. Click next.
  15. All the appropriate settings should already be set. Click finish.
  16. Delete column A because it contains the extra section number appended to the student ID.
  17. All leading zeros were deleted during this process so we must now add them back in. Select the student ID column and from the drop-down menu at the top middle of the screen, select "text."
  18. Now go down through the ID numbers and add however many zeros are necessary to the beginning of the number to bring the digit count up to 9.
  19. Go to "file" at the top of the page and select "save."
  20. Choose a location to save the file.
  21. Change the file type to CSV (Comma delimited) by clicking the drop-down menu below the file name andthen click "save."
  22. Click "ok" in response to any pop-up message windows.
  23. Now you can import the scores. You will need to have already created a column in the gradebook of the appropriate course that can receive the grades.
  24. Enter the gradebook and choose the "import scores" option.
  25. Uncheck "header row."
  26. Choose the CSV file and click continue.
  27. Choose "external ID" from the drop-down menu of the left column.
  28. Choose the title of the gradebook column that you wish to fill with scores from the right hand column dropdown menu.
  29. Choose "points" from the second drop-down menu, which will appear beneath the previous one.
  30. Select "import."
  31. Check to be sure the scores have appeared correctly in the gradebook.
